channel.title: My first attempt at a server is backfiring badly
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I've spent over 12 hours on trying to make a server. I've wanted to make one since about 2 years ago when I first found out about servers.
Anyway, so here are some of my questions, and photoes of how I have everything set up.
[IMG]http://i268.photobucket.com/albums/jj21/XS4rad0min/Picture1.png[/img] [IMG]http://i268.photobucket.com/albums/jj21/XS4rad0min/Picture2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i268.photobucket.com/albums/jj21/XS4rad0min/Picture3.png[/img]
I think I've port forwarded correctly. I've set the compiler to the correct path (Program Files (x86), java 21 instead of 16). I'm completely stumped.
I'm using a source, so there aren't any issues with that hopefully.
Everything works fine on 127.0.0.1 except for it crashes sometimes when I attack things
Please help me realize my dream of owning a server. If you do, I'll give you co-owner, and love you forever :)
Thank you very much!

item.title: My first attempt at a server is backfiring badly
item.dc:creator: @Z0xo Z0xo
item.description:
@Z0xo wrote:

ok I’ll remove it…

but thanks to everyone who helped me, and if you want mod or admin then please pm me

Read full topic

item.title: My first attempt at a server is backfiring badly
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Z0xo, post:12, topic:358723”]it’s actually working now! thanks b15

server = disasterscape.no-ip.info

whoever helped me, use your mopar username on here, and I’ll give you mod or admin depending how helpful your post was[/quote]Technically that’s advertising your server, not allowed.

Read full topic

Z0xo, Make sure to put your “LOCAL IP” not your “REMOTE IP” ir local should look like this “192.168.2.2”

item.title: My first attempt at a server is backfiring badly
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Z0xo, post:6, topic:358723”]The host is already created, i was in the ‘edit’ form when i took that picture

EDIT:
I checked port 43594 with a Port Checker, here’s what I got:

Success: I can see your service on [my IP address] on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594

That’s good, right?[/quote]

Yes, you have port forwarded correctly.

Read full topic
item.source: My first attempt at a server is backfiring badly

item.title: My first attempt at a server is backfiring badly
item.dc:creator: @Z0xo Z0xo
item.description:
@Z0xo wrote:

The host is already created, i was in the ‘edit’ form when i took that picture

EDIT:
I checked port 43594 with a Port Checker, here’s what I got:

Success: I can see your service on [my IP address] on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594

That’s good, right?

Read full topic

item.title: My first attempt at a server is backfiring badly
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Z0xo:

Do i put 127.0.0.1, which is what I can get to in my network?

No, leave don’t touch it, leave it with the information thats already in it, just create your no-ip and then click create host or whatever.
